skill.name: dev-servers
skill.description: Start the backend (FastAPI/uvicorn) and frontend (Vite) development servers. Use when user mentions "start dev", "run servers", "launch app", "start the app", or needs to run the application locally.

security_audit.summary: Prompt-only skill with explicit command definitions and appropriate guardrails. Legitimate dev tool behavior matching stated purpose.

low_findings.title: External command execution via Bash tool
low_findings.description: The skill provides instructions for the AI to execute shell commands including 'pip install', 'npm install', 'uvicorn', and 'npm run dev'. These are legitimate dev commands explicitly listed in the instructions. The skill includes guardrails to protect sensitive data (OPENAI_API_KEY).

low_findings.title: Filesystem access for dependency detection
low_findings.description: The skill checks for backend/venv/, frontend/node_modules/, and backend/.env files. These checks are standard for dev environment setup and explicitly documented.

content.value_statement: Running web applications locally requires starting multiple servers and managing dependencies. This skill automates the process of installing dependencies and launching both FastAPI backend and Vite frontend servers.
actual_capabilities: Start FastAPI backend server on port 8000
Start Vite frontend server on port 5173
Check for port conflicts before starting
limitations: Requires existing project structure with backend/ and frontend/ directories
Cannot create new project from scratch
Requires user confirmation for dependency installation

use_cases.title: Full-stack Application Development
use_cases.description: Run both backend and frontend servers simultaneously for full-stack web application development with hot reload

use_cases.title: Backend API Development
use_cases.description: Start only the FastAPI backend server for API development and testing with automatic reload

use_cases.title: Frontend UI Development
use_cases.description: Start only the Vite frontend server for React or Vue component development with hot module replacement

best_practices: Run backend and frontend in separate terminals for cleaner logs
Keep .env file secure and never commit it to version control
Check port availability if servers fail to start
anti_patterns: Starting servers without verifying dependencies first
Exposing API keys in server logs or error messages

faq.question: What if ports 8000 or 5173 are already in use?
faq.answer: The skill will warn about port conflicts. You may need to stop existing processes or configure alternative ports in your server configuration files.

faq.question: Can I run only the backend server?
faq.answer: Yes, you can ask specifically to start only the backend server. The skill will start FastAPI with uvicorn on port 8000.

faq.question: Do I need to install dependencies manually first?
faq.answer: No, the skill checks for existing dependencies and offers to install them if missing. It confirms with you before installation.

faq.question: Is my API key safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill includes guardrails to never expose or log the OPENAI_API_KEY from your .env file.

faq.question: What project structure is required?
faq.answer: The skill expects a backend/ directory with venv/ and main.py, plus a frontend/ directory with package.json and node_modules/.

faq.question: How is this skill different from other server tools?
faq.answer: This skill specifically targets FastAPI and Vite stack, providing automated dependency checking and sequential server startup.
